intro: Rhododendron laojunshanense, commonly known as the Laojunshan rhododendron, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with acidic soils and high humidity. Its floral display, which ranges from pink to red, occurs in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation priority.
